item.title: Set Up Proxy on Amazon EC2 Ubuntu
item.description: 1. Setting up the EC2 Instance Launch an EC2 Instance Choose an Ubuntu Server image. Select an appropriate instance type. Configure instance details, storage, and security group. Ensure your security group allows inbound traffic on the ports you plan to use for your proxy (typically port 3128 for Squid). Review and launch the instance. Create and download a key pair for SSH access. (optional, can connect through AWS console later) 2. Connect to Your Instance Use SSH client with the instance’s public DNS/IP and the key pair:
